result.execSummary:
The defendant David V Berry was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Knowingly Violate a Domestic Abuse Order - Injunction, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 813.12(8)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

09:02 AM Defendant David V Berry in court, in custody, with attorney J Andrew Herbers.   Peter Michael Tempelis appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Case called for plea and sentencing.
State is in compliance with victim's rights. 
State places global offer on the record.
Court conducts plea colloquy.

Defendant enters a plea of no contest to Count 1,  Court finds defendant guilty.
Case 22CM261 is Dismissed and read in.
State and Defense make sentencing recommendations.
Defendant makes statement to the court. 

The defendant was sentenced to the following:

JAIL:  67 days (Credit - 67 days). TIME SERVED;

COSTS: $243; 
DNA SURCHARGE:  $200;
Defendant to provide DNA sample, within (3) business days at the Waukesha County Sheriff Department.

Payment of Costs/Surcharges:  Civil Judgment to be entered.
with Elements of criminal offenses to which plea is being entered.

08:33 AM Defendant David V Berry in court, in custody, with attorney J Andrew Herbers.    District Attorney's Office Law, Alyssa Jay, Intern appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defense is negotiating with the state and expects resolution.  
  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for May 26, 2022 at 09:00 am.

CASH BOND AMENDED DOWN FROM $250 TO $150 WITH THE SAME CONDITIONS.

Defendant to comply with I.D. Processing.  Defendant to have no contact with Victim A listed in the Criminal Complaint/Victim Identification Key.  Defendant is not to share, reproduce or distribute any personal and/or identifying information about the crime victim(s), except to their attorney.

01:32 PM Defendant David V Berry in court, in custody, with attorney J Andrew Herbers.   Kevin Michael Osborne appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Case called for Bail/Bond Hearing in 22CM261 and 22CM486.
Atty Herbers makes arguments for modifying the bond.
Victim rights have been complied with by the Waukesha County District Attorneys Office.
State makes argument for some cash bond on each case.
Court orders the cash bond lowered from $250 on each case to $150 on each case with the same conditions. 
State to send an offer to the Defense.
The next hearing currently scheduled with the court will remain.
Authorization to appear received and filed.
Bail/bond hearing on April 6, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
